abstract.text: Manages consent state and user preferences for conversations and contacts.
Represents a public identity on the XMTP network.
A callback invoked before a key authentication event, giving the app a chance to
prepare the UI (e.g., show a signing prompt) before the user is asked to sign.

Errors that can occur when creating or interacting with conversations.

Logger namespace for XMTP SDK
ContentTypeId is used to identify the type of content stored in a Message.
A type representing a structured intent from a message.
Represents a message that has been deleted.
This is used in enriched messages to indicate that a message was deleted.
Signature kind used in identity operations
Metadata associated with a message, such as sender and timestamp information.
A summary of the results from syncing all conversations.
The sort order for message queries.

The membership state of the current client within a group conversation.

A decoded message from an XMTP conversation.

An enriched decoded message with reactions and replies baked in.
Ciphertext represents encrypted payload.
It is definited as a union to support cryptographic algorithm agility.
The payload is accompanied by the cryptographic parameters
required by the chosen encryption scheme.
A unique, network-assigned identifier for an XMTP inbox.
The delivery status of a message on the XMTP network.
The primary entry point for interacting with the XMTP messaging network.
A standardized signing interface for XMTP clients supporting EOA, SCW, and Passkeys.

during creation, identity resolution, or configuration.
The type of account identifier used to create an XMTP identity.

and

Handles listing and creating Conversations.
A 1:1 direct message conversation between two participants.
Represents a request to delete a message.
This content type is used to request deletion of a specific message in a conversation.
The message will be deleted for all participants.
EncodedContent bundles the content with metadata identifying its type
and parameters required for correct decoding and presentation of the content.
Controls the sort order of conversations returned by list methods.
Options that control the visibility and notification behavior of a message
Represents a leave request message sent when a user wants to leave a group.
This content type is used to notify group members when a participant requests to leave.
